page.title: 15BRACKENBURGH MANSION
page.content:
Originally a pele tower (a defended farmstead) within the Royal Inglewood Forest, the building was substantially extended in 1902.
The grounds are exceptionally well tended for a building of this size, and contain a small but deep swimming pool.
An interesting feature of Brackenburgh is the "Ha Ha", which is a concealed wall designed to prevent the entry of cattle, without obstructing the landscape and view.
In the period of extension, a large archway was moved to the entrance area. A back road entrance was abandoned as being too steep for practical purposes.
